dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 2573 IH: Accessing Higher Education Opportunities Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ruiz introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to authorize additional grant activities for Hispanic-serving institutions.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Accessing Higher Education Opportunities Act.
Subsection (b) of section 503 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1101b(b)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (7) through (16) as paragraphs (9) through (18), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (6) the following:

Student support programs (which may include counseling, mentoring, and other support services) designed to facilitate the successful advancement of students from four-year institutions to postbaccalaureate doctoral degree granting programs that prepare students for health care occupations as such occupations are described in the most recent edition of the Occupational Outlook Handbook published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
Developing or expanding access to dual or concurrent enrollment programs and early college high school programs.

subsection.text: There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out part A of title V of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1101 et seq.), as amended by this Act, $107,795,000 for fiscal year 2018.
Section 422 of the General Education Provisions Act (20 U.S.C. 1226a) shall not apply to further extend the duration of the authority under subsection (a).
